The community you all have created is one of safety in Christ and with one another. Every community in the world needs this. I'm so inspired and excited to see how God is going to use re:generation as a tool for not just recovery, but for discipleship."

answer.en-US: Watermark Resources exists to bring glory to God by equipping and inspiring churches around the world to be and make disciples. As a ministry, we strive to generously serve churches around the world with resources and training that have been developed by [Watermark Community Church](http://www.watermark.org).

quote.en-US: “re|engage has become the highlight of my week; I look forward to seeing how God uses this program to reach not just the broken marriages in our church, but in the community where we live.”

intro.en-US:
# Broken, hurting, and disheartened people fill our churches week in and week out. 
Unmet expectations and unfair life circumstances can lead to sin and pain. These are often barriers making recovery seem impossible. Yet with God, no one is too far out of reach. We believe anyone can experience new life and freedom in Christ. The way we help is through *re:generation*, a biblical 12-step recovery program. Does your church have a place for the brokenhearted to find healing? Do you want to start *re:generation* at your church or rework your current recovery ministry? We are hosting the *re:generation* Training Conference, where you can connect with other ministry leaders and walk away with the vision, resources, and tools needed to build and sustain a healthy recovery ministry. We offer two conference tracks: one for those wishing to implement *re:generation* and another for those currently developing the ministry.  


Can't make it to this conference? Join us for the [Church Leaders Conference](https://www.watermarkresources.com/conferences/clc "Church Leaders Conference")!

body.en-US:
# Conference Schedule
This is an example of the schedule you can expect at the *re:generation* Training Conference.

### Monday
| Start Time | Activity   |
| ----------:| ---------- |
| 8:15 AM | Check In & Breakfast 
| 9:00 AM | Worship & Welcome       |
| 9:30 AM | __SESSION 1: re:generation Mission & Vision__ |
| 10:15 AM| __SESSION 2: re:generation Distinctives__ |
| 11:00 AM| Church Introductions       |
| 11:30 AM| Lunch       |
| 1:00 PM | Breakout 1.1: Ministry Model and Support Structure |
| | Breakout 1.2: Challenges Common & New |
| 2:15 PM | Break |
| 2:30 PM | Breakout 2.1: Starting Recovery in Your Church  |
| | Breakout 2.2: Transitioning an Existing Ministry to re:generation |
| | Breakout 2.3: Discussion and How Can We Improve re:gen |
| 3:30 PM | re:generation Q&A |
| 4:00 PM | Team Time/Facility Tour/Personal Time |
| 5:30 PM | re:generation Leader Dinner |
| 6:30 PM | re:generation Begins |
| 8:30 PM | Optional Self-Led Team Debrief |

### Tuesday
| Start Time | Activity   |
| ----------:| ---------- |
| 8:00 AM | Breakfast & Fellowship with Other Churches |
| 8:30 AM | Worship/Prayer/Testimony | 
| 9:00 AM | __SESSION 3: Recruiting/Assimilating/Equipping Lay Leaders__|
| 10:30 AM| __SESSION 4: 5 Mistakes We’ve Made, 5 Best Practices__ |
| 11:30 AM| Lunch & Networking | 
| 1:00 PM | re:generation Testimony | 
| 1:30 PM  | Breakouts | 
| 2:30 PM | Break |
| 2:45 PM | Breakouts |
| 4:00 PM | __SESSION 5: Dealing with Habitual Sin__ |
| 5:00 PM | Closing & Communion |
| 6:00 PM | Dinner |

Throughout the two day conference, a light breakfast, a full lunch and full dinner will be provided to each participant. Additionally, snacks and drinks during breaks will be provided. If you have any dietary restrictions, please let us know and we will do our best to accommodate your needs.

# Parking

Uber and Lyft are available in Dallas and both are a great option for transportation to and from the airport.

There is no better way to love another person, and no other way a man/woman can learn to love, than to lead them into a fully ENGAGED relationship with Jesus Christ. re|engage was designed to be and always will be a discipleship ministry."

intro.en-US:
### Reconnect, reignite, and resurrect your marriage
Whether marriages in your church need to be reignited, or be completely resurrected, re|engage is a safe place for couples to reconnect. This ministry offers hope to marriages by helping couples move toward oneness through stories of grace, teaching, and small groups. Re|engage is a marriage enrichment program; whether couples are struggling to get along, have broken relationships, or simply want to grow closer together, marriages in any condition can benefit.

To make a reservation at the Westin for this conference, you can [book online](http://www.starwoodhotels.com/westin/rates/rate.html?propertyID=472&rp=SN:430499,,,&language=en_US&EM=oneclickURL_430499_SETWATWD_BOOK_WI_472_NAD).

The Residence Inn Park Central is also within walking distance to the church. To make a reservation at The Residence Inn, you can call (972) 503-1333.

title.en-US: God took our mess and made it into something beautiful.

body.en-US:
Whether couples rate their marriages as 2s or 10s, re|engage is a safe place to reconnect. Couples from across the spectrum are never alone and engage with one another in this ministry through:

- __Large Group |__ An opportunity for all couples in all phases of the  ministry to worship, pray, and learn together. During this time, you will hear couples publicly share their marriage story and leaders teach principles for marriage growth. 
 
- __Small Group |__ Couples will then move into a Small Group setting. Different destinations are offered for each stage of the re|engage process. These stages include:

  - __Newcomers |__ Offered for first-time attendees, this setting includes leaders sharing their marriage story, explaining the re|engage process, and discussing next steps. This is a safe environment for couples to come and hear what this ministry is all about with no expectation to share.

  - __Open Group |__ As couples await being placed into a Closed Group, they will attend Open Group, which offers couples the opportunity to begin working on their marriage. This environment fosters group discussion on different marriage topics while also creating the space to begin sharing each other’s stories. Participants learn the value and ground rules of Small Group.
    
    - __Closed Group |__ When enough couples are ready to join, and a facilitator couple is ready, a Closed Group is formed with 4-5 participating couples to walk through the 16-lesson curriculum together. Once formed, no new couples are added to the Closed Group.

text.en-US: Want to use re|engage at your church? Take your first step by filling out this interest form.

# Didn't answer all of your questions? 
Fill out this contact form to let us know how we can best help you and one of our team members will reply as soon as possible.

question.en-US: What types of resources are offered?

answer.en-US: Our team serves and develops church leaders by creating ministry content and tools, providing on-going coaching and training, and hosting energizing events. Explore our site to learn more about these opportunities!
Yes and no. If you're wanting something physical, we charge for it. If it's digital, it's free. Though we might ask for your email address.

question.en-US: What is needed to start a program at my church?

answer.en-US: The first step is to [fill out an application](https://watermark.formstack.com/forms/resources_interest_form). We will then reach out to you to set up a call. Our team will help you process what the best next step is for your church’s current needs.

question.en-US: What if I have more questions?

answer.en-US: Have no fear! We have lots of resources and answers on this site. [Visit the About page](/about) to learn about our ministries, conferences, and equipping tools. If you still have questions, please [get in contact with us](/contact). One of our team members will get you an answer!

detailedDescription.en-US:
# Why should you start re|engage at your church?
1. Re|engage *__prevents staff burnout and fatigue__* as it creates a clear path for counseling couples. re|engage was partly designed to help offload the marriage counseling burden felt by our church staff. Volunteers can be positioned for success to take on this responsibility (2 Peter 1:3).

2. The need for discipleship in re|engage *__creates service opportunities__* for the local body of Christ. re|engage drives a need for leader couples who in turn love other couples at a time when they are hurting (1 John 3:18). Additionally, leader couples often experience improvement in their own marriage as a result of serving. [Hear from one such couple!](https://vimeo.com/125728428 "McCuen Testimony")

3. Re|engage becomes a *__side door into a relationship with Christ__*. Couples who may never walk through the front door of your church may be driven to re|engage and the good news of Jesus Christ by the pain they are feeling in a strained marital relationship (Matthew 11:28).

4. The structure and format provide a great *__opportunity to make disciples__*. The re|engage curriculum is the gospel applied to marriage (Ephesians 5:25). Participants in re|engage are often confronted with a loving God they have never met and ultimately embrace His free gift. 

5. Families are only as healthy as the marriages are. Having re|engage produces a *__synergistic effect on your Children's and Student ministries__*. As kids see their parents model the relationship that God intended, families are strengthened and united (Proverbs 14:26).

6. Open and honest discussion *__injects a dose of authenticity into your church__*. The transparency that is a by-product of re|engage Closed Groups can be infectious. Many couples who complete re|engage are no longer satisfied with "putting on a face" at church, but realize that true freedom is found in being fully known by others (Proverbs 28:13).

body.en-US:
# Other Frequently Asked Questions
__Can a couple lead in re|engage if one or both of the spouses were previously married to another?__
A history of divorce does not alone disqualify them from serving in re|engage.  A few factors we would look at:

- Their attitude towards divorce. We want to see a posture of humility where they acknowledge that divorce was not God's best for them. It may be more difficult for divorced couples to lead re|engage groups because they may have couples in their group considering divorce themselves.
- How long have they been married to their current spouse? We would not consider anyone who's been married less than 5 years. You want to see a track record of faithfulness.
- Do they have multiple divorces in their background. The more divorces, the more pause it gives, primarily because they've not shown a respect for the institution that God created.
- Are they willing to say that divorce and their divorce was not God’s best and that God’s heart is for reconciliation?


__Will re|engage work in all church sizes?__
Re|engage works in churches with 150 people and 15,000 people. The program is adaptable to your church environment. However, there are three program elements required for every church and these may be affected by size:

- A large group time must be offered where everyone going through the program comes together and hears a testimony or teaching. The size of this gathering can vary, but the principles remain the same.
- Couples must be placed in small groups of 4-6 couples that go through the curriculum together.
- The curriculum must be used in its entirety, without modification. It has been honed over time, builds on itself, and the topics complement one another.
